about.name: Washington, D.C.
about.info_text: Washington, D.C., the capital of the United States, is a city rich in history, culture, and political significance. It is known for its iconic landmarks, including the White House, the U.S. Capitol, and the Washington Monument. Visitors to D.C. can explore world-class museums and galleries, enjoy the beauty of the National Mall, and delve into the nation's history. The city is also celebrated for its diverse neighborhoods, excellent dining, and vibrant arts scene.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 689,545
State: Washington, D.C.
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Languages: English
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Washington, D.C. experiences a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are typically hot and humid, while winters can be cold with occasional snowfall.

attractions_card.title: The National Mall
attractions_card.description: The National Mall is a sprawling green space in the heart of D.C., surrounded by the city's iconic monuments, memorials, and museums.

attractions_card.title: The White House
attractions_card.description: The White House is the official residence and workplace of the President of the United States, and it is a symbol of American democracy.

attractions_card.title: Smithsonian Museums
attractions_card.description: The Smithsonian Institution operates numerous museums in D.C., covering a wide range of topics, from art and history to science and aviation.

attractions_card.title: The U.S. Capitol
attractions_card.description: The U.S. Capitol is the home of the United States Congress and an architectural marvel, featuring the stunning Capitol Rotunda.

attractions_card.title: The Lincoln Memorial
attractions_card.description: The Lincoln Memorial honors Abraham Lincoln and is famous for its large statue of the 16th President of the United States.

attractions_card.title: The Washington Monument
attractions_card.description: The Washington Monument is an iconic obelisk dedicated to George Washington, offering panoramic views of the city from its observation deck.

attractions_card.title: The National Gallery of Art
attractions_card.description: The National Gallery of Art is a world-class art museum featuring an extensive collection of European and American masterpieces.

attractions_card.title: The Library of Congress
attractions_card.description: The Library of Congress is the largest library in the world, with a vast collection of books, manuscripts, and historic documents.

food_card.title: Ben's Chili Bowl
food_card.description: Ben's Chili Bowl is a D.C. institution known for its half-smokes and chili dogs, a favorite among locals and visitors.

food_card.title: Ethnic Cuisine
food_card.description: Washington, D.C. offers a diverse range of international cuisine, from Ethiopian and Vietnamese to Caribbean and Peruvian dishes.

food_card.title: Food Trucks
food_card.description: The city is famous for its food truck scene, with vendors serving up a variety of delicious street food options.

food_card.title: Farmers Markets
food_card.description: Farmers markets throughout D.C. provide fresh, local produce and artisanal products for those looking to savor the flavors of the region.

food_card.title: Classic D.C. Cocktails
food_card.description: Explore classic D.C. cocktails, such as the Rickey and the Gin Rickey, in the city's historic bars and speakeasies.

hotels_card.title: The Watergate Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Watergate Hotel is a luxury hotel with a historic past, offering elegant accommodations and stunning views of the Potomac River.

hotels_card.title: The Mayflower Hotel, Autograph Collection
hotels_card.description: The Mayflower Hotel is a historic landmark with opulent rooms and a prime location near the White House and museums.

hotels_card.title: The Willard InterContinental
hotels_card.description: The Willard InterContinental is a grand and historic hotel offering luxurious accommodations and a central downtown location.

hotels_card.title: The Line Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Line Hotel is a trendy and stylish option, known for its vibrant atmosphere and artistic design.

hotels_card.title: The Kimpton George Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Kimpton George Hotel is a boutique hotel with personality, providing a comfortable and unique stay.

hotels_card.title: Eaton DC
hotels_card.description: Eaton DC is a socially conscious hotel, combining hospitality with progressive and cultural experiences.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Washington, D.C.
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton offers unparalleled luxury and exceptional service in the heart of the city.

hotels_card.title: The Hay-Adams
hotels_card.description: The Hay-Adams is a historic boutique hotel overlooking the White House, providing classic elegance and timeless charm.

transport_card.title: Washington Metro
transport_card.description: The Washington Metro provides a convenient way to navigate the city with its extensive subway system.

transport_card.title: Metrobus
transport_card.description: Metrobus services complement the Metro system, offering bus transportation to various destinations in the D.C. area.

transport_card.title: Capital Bikeshare
transport_card.description: Capital Bikeshare provides bike-sharing services, allowing you to explore the city on two wheels.

transport_card.title: D.C. Circulator
transport_card.description: The D.C. Circulator is a convenient bus service that operates in specific neighborhoods, including downtown D.C.

transport_card.title: Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport
transport_card.description: Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport (DCA) is the closest airport to downtown D.C., offering domestic flights.

transport_card.title: Union Station
transport_card.description: Union Station serves as a transportation hub for Amtrak and regional trains, making it easy to reach D.C. by rail.

transport_card.title: Car Rentals
transport_card.description: Car rental agencies are available for those who prefer to have their own transportation while exploring Washington, D.C.
